job_title: Certified Medical Assistant in Chicago, IL
pros: Great benefits and a good experience working in the community.Doctors provide excellent care for the patients and focus on improvement measures.
cons: EMR moves extremely slow.There is a lack of education and training programs for staff. Staff needs improvement with basic customer service skills "greeting" often rude to patients and fellow co workers. Leadership does not exist, no accountability, no rules in place, staff is often late and leave early. "Come and go as you please attitudes"

pros: I liked working at Friend Family Health Center. The work hours were reasonable.
cons:
It would have been good to sometimes work remote. Some staff are more productive in a hybrid or remote environment.

Some staff may want to do more for organization but the true value and impact that they could have had to help improve the organization may have been underutilized.

pros: As a student intern looking to get experience, there is a lot of moving around to gain experience in other places.
cons: There is no structure and last minute changes to work locations.

review_title: Difficult Place To Work If You Truly Care About Patients
job_title: Behavioral Health Consultant in Chicago, IL
pros: 401k plan is matching dollar for dollar up to 5% of salary
cons:
There is more focus on revenue as oppose to patient care and employee satisfaction. Clinic is ran horribly and patients are put into 15 minutes interval slots. How do you properly assess and diagnose your patients in such a short period especially for mental health issues.

The facility cleaning practices are subpar I've never seen a health setting be so dirty. Food and dirt can sit on floors for weeks before being cleaned up.

job_title: Advanced Practice Provider in Chicago, IL
pros:
- Work with other APN/MD/PA colleagues passionate about making a difference
- Good salary and decent benefits
- Rewarding community to serve
cons:
- High volume clinic with 25-35 scheduled appointments daily
- Disorganized administration and clinic flow
- Leadership which treats its staff as dispensable

review_title: Very Busy Clinic, never a dull moment. Awesome providers.
pros: Good benefit package, plenty of time off.  Regular full time hours w/one Saturday a month.
cons: No accountability for coworkers that underperform. Parking for employees is not free on Cottage Grove.

pros: Some really fantastic doctors work at the clinic!
cons: Low pay is the biggest concern.

review_title: An FQHC driven strictly on numbers
job_title: Advanced Practice Nurse in Chicago, IL
cons: Lack of provider/employee advocacy; lack of effective communication; ineffective leadership; terrible patient scheduling; lack of consistency

job_title: Customer Support Representative in Chicago, IL
pros: hours and location were pretty great
cons: not enough staff for a call center, rude personnel, no professionalism

job_title: Call Center Representative in Chicago, IL
cons: not enough call center representatives for multiple locations and specialties

pros: The working hours at the clinic

review_title: False Advertisement! FFHC  rents space from University of Chicago. University of Chicago does not own FFHC!
